result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Terry J Robinson in court.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court for Terry J Robinson.  Attorney Jennifer Tate for John J Rejowski in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1, 2 and 3.  

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defendant is advised is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  
Defendant is advised unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  

Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 4.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 09:30 am.
State's Recommendation.
Jury Instructions for plea hearing.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea.

Defendant Terry J Robinson in court.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court for Terry J Robinson.  Attorney John J Rejowski in court for State of Wisconsin. Final Pretrial held. State places offer on the record. Defendant wishes to take the offer. Case adjourned in Branch 4.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine, received and filed.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant Terry J Robinson in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by the final pretrial date. Any other motions and notice of alibi must be filed by the final pretrial. Court further advises that any suppression type motions need to be filed by 8/19/2022. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 4.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-2-2022, filed.

Court granted appearance wavied for on record hearing.   Case in court for status conference. Defense requests motion hearing date. Defense motion due by 7-1-2022. State reply by 7-22-2022. Any reply 7-29-2022. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Parties are requesting more time to review discovery. Court grants adjournment. Defense is requesting bail modification. Arguments heard. Court grants bail motion. Court orders $1,500 cash bail. Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant Terry J Robinson not in court, in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense requests more time for review. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Terry J Robinson in court with Attorney Michael L. Chernin; both appear by video.  Defendant Terry J Robinson in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 04, Judge Hanrahan. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Chernin has been retained and provided the next court date by telephone.

Defendant Terry J Robinson not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered an oral no contact order with the co-defendant.

Defendant Terry J Robinson in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Terry J Robinson in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
